alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 16 at 2:16AM PST until December 16 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 2000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches with 2 to 3 inches above 3000 feet. * WHERE...Portions of Central and Southern Douglas County and Jackson County including Canyon Mountain Pass on Interstate 5, Jacksonville Hill on Highway 238, Ashland, Butte Falls, Prospect and hills surrounding the Rogue Valley and Applegate Valley. * WHEN...Until 9 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is possible below 2000 feet in any heavier showers that move through. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
